subject: RE: [junit] Remote pairing
msgSnippet: Shane, thanks for your reply. NetBeans Collab sounds worth a try for me! :-) Matt ________________________________ From: junit@yahoogroups.com
messageBody:
Shane,

thanks for your reply. NetBeans Collab sounds worth a try for me! :-)

Matt


________________________________

From: junit@yahoogroups.com [mailto:junit@yahoogroups.com] On Behalf Of
Shane Mingins
Sent: Wednesday, April 11, 2007 4:00 AM
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Subject: Re: [junit] Remote pairing



Hi

I was looking around for something similar today and found that the
netbeans
ide has developer collaboration available as a plugin.

We tried our first session with it today and it served it's purpose. The
response time was not immediate but was not too bad.

I was pairing with a guy in US and I am in NZ :-) I was using a
development build of netbeans only because we were working on ruby/rails
code and wanted the syntax highlighting ... but I also had it working
on 5.5the latest production build.

Anyway, thought I'd mention it in case others are interested.

Cheers
Shane
